title: Job 12:1
text: AND Job answered and said,

title: Job 12:2
text: No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.

title: Job 12:3
text: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?

title: Job 12:4
text: I am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.

title: Job 12:5
text: He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.

title: Job 12:6
text: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.

title: Job 12:7
text: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:

title: Job 12:8
text: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.

title: Job 12:9
text: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the LORD hath wrought this?

title: Job 12:10
text: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.

title: Job 12:11
text: Doth not the ear try words?  and the mouth taste his meat?

title: Job 12:12
text: With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.

title: Job 12:13
text: With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.

title: Job 12:14
text: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.

title: Job 12:15
text: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

title: Job 12:16
text: With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.

title: Job 12:17
text: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.

title: Job 12:18
text: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.

title: Job 12:19
text: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.

title: Job 12:20
text: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.

title: Job 12:21
text: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.

title: Job 12:22
text: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.

title: Job 12:23
text: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again.

title: Job 12:24
text: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.

title: Job 12:25
text: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
